text: I tell you what I've learned in in
dabbling in the in the different media
is writing a screenplay for an animated
film is one thing writing a screenplay
for a liveaction film is another thing
writing a screenplay for a video game is
fascinating and and great and the
disciplines are very different because
you're you're not only thinking about
language you're thinking about immersion
techniques if you would how are you
going to make the the viewer or the
player the gamer uh immerse into the
world and as a uh writer of fiction
that's again almost a different set of
rules uh in some of these mediums uh the
the sort of Aristotelian structure of
pract or you know beginning middle and
end uh goes away at certain points and I
find that truly thrilling but what what
has been great for me in writing fiction
is that a I don't deal with notes from
anyone I I have free reign uh over what
characters do what and the fate of the
characters there's no there's not such a
thing as a down ending in in writing
fiction you know you you can please the
tale rather than please the the
demographics and the quadrants of a
movie uh but but I would say the same
kind can be done doing an independent
European or Mexican film you have that
freedom what is great here is that
you movie making the process of making
the movie goes against the product it's
like sculpting I think Francis Copa said
is like sculpting with sand in a
sandstorm you know things are flying
away from your hands as you're trying to
shape the
thing and and I agree I mean so the the
process of the movie making goes against
the product and at the end of the day
you end up with a movie that compromises
it compromises with the budget with the
time with the elements uh there's no
filmmaker that can have absolute control
unless you're making an animated film in
abstract and in instead of that in
fiction uh the moment you are writing
the scene is as good or as bad as you're
writing it it you can see the product
come to life and that's its final form
so it's it's very much like painting in
that or illustrating you depend on your

is part of the process in movies it
